author: VideoElephant
title: Millions of U.S. workers will see a pay increase in 2024
text: At the start of the new year, 22 states and 43 cities and counties are increasing the hourly minimum wage, benefiting nearly 10 million people. And that doesn't only affect workers at major fast food chains or retail outlets; it also includes people who work at small, locally-owned businesses. spotlight Millions of U.S. workers will see a pay increase in 2024 - VideoElephant - - [0](https://greensboro.com/news/nation-world/government-politics/millions-of-u-s-workers-will-see-a-pay-increase-in-2024/article_aeaf3d61-2a0d-54e8-8ba3-11955e11749f.html?mode=comments) Related to this story Most Popular Maine has removed former President Donald Trump from the state’s presidential primary ballot under the Constitution’s insurrection clause in a… [ What might a second Trump presidency look like? author: Reuters
title: Florida lawmakers vote to limit children’s access to social media
text:
A minor using mobile phone/browsing social media. STOCK IMAGE The Florida House of Representatives approved on Wednesday a bill aimed at barring children age 16 and younger from social media platforms, following similar action in several states to limit online risks to young teenagers.
Passed by a bipartisan vote of 106 to 13, the measure would require social media platforms to terminate the accounts of anyone under 17 years old and use a third-party verification system to screen out the underaged.
“We must address the harmful effects social media platforms have on the development and well-being of our kids,” said Florida Speaker Paul Renner.
ADVERTISEMENT “Florida has a compelling state interest and duty to protect our children, their mental health and their childhood.”
FEATURED STORIES Necessary measure The bill would also require firms to permanently delete personal information collected from the terminated accounts and let parents bring civil suits against those failing to do so.
The legislation now goes to the Florida state Senate for consideration. Republicans control both chambers of the state legislature.
READ: US top health official sounds alarm on child social media use
Sponsors said the measure was necessary to protect children from depression, anxiety and other mental health woes they say are linked to excessive use of social media, whose addictive aspects critics say make children especially vulnerable.
Opponents argued that the bill goes too far, with some urging less restrictive measures, such as letting parents opt in or out of allowing their children to use social media.
Meta opposition Meta, the parent company of Instagram and Facebook, opposed the legislation, usually referred to as House Bill No. 1 (HB 1), saying it would limit parental discretion and raise data privacy concerns.
ADVERTISEMENT “HB 1 would require each new social media user, from a 13-year-old in Miami to a 73-year-old from Boca Raton, to provide possibly sensitive identifying information, such as a driver’s license or birth certificate to a third-party organization to verify their age,” Meta’s Caulder Childs told the House’s judiciary committee at a hearing on Jan. 17.
Meta says it supports federal legislation for online app stores to secure parents’ approval for downloads by teenagers younger than 16.
‘Addictive, harmful’ The Florida measure does not identify any internet companies by name.
Instead it defines a social media platform as an online forum that tracks account holders’ activity by letting them create user profiles, then upload content or view the content or activities of other users and interact with, or track, them.
READ: New York lawmakers target ‘addictive’ social media feeds for kids
Among the defining social media functions highlighted by the bill are “addictive, harmful or deceptive design features” or those that induce “an excessive or compulsive need to use or engage with” the platform.
Exceptions But the measure exempts websites and applications whose predominant function is email, messaging or texting, as well as streaming services, news, sports and entertainment sites, along with online shopping, gaming and academic sites.
Utah became the first US state to adopt laws regulating children’s access to social media in March 2023, followed by others, such as Arkansas, Louisiana, Ohio and Texas, according to a legislative analysis prepared for the Florida bill.
It said numerous other states were also contemplating similar regulations.

author: Мария Крылова
title: SHOT: Российские туристы застряли на острове Хайнань из-за тайфуна
text:
На острове закрыты пляжи. Возле них дежурит охрана, которая не пускает туристов к воде.
Из-за непогоды аэропорт в Санье закрыт на несколько дней. Все рейсы перенесены.
В результате российские туристы не могут вернуться в Москву, Красноярск и другие города.
Власти объявили четвертый уровень экстренного реагирования. На кадрах, сделанных туристами, видно, что на острове идет проливной дождь, дует сильный ветер.

author: 张苇柠
title: 教育部启动高校毕业生就业政策宣传月活动 - 就业 - 中工网
text:
经济日报北京6月11日讯（记者李丹）教育部日前印发《关于开展2025年高校毕业生就业创业政策宣传月活动的通知》，部署6月至7月在全国范围内开展2025年高校毕业生就业政策宣传月活动，深入贯彻落实党中央、国务院“稳就业”决策部署，帮助用人单位和毕业生充分知晓并用好就业优惠政策，促进高校毕业生高质量充分就业。
2025年“政策宣传月”活动主题为“政策护航 加力扩岗”，聚焦政策宣传到位，带动政策服务到位，促进政策落实到位，重点宣传中央及各地区、各部门出台的面向用人单位的一次性扩岗补助、社保补贴、培训补贴等稳岗扩岗政策，以及面向高校毕业生的稳就业政策。教育部编制了促进高校毕业生就业政策清单，在国家大学生就业服务平台推出高校毕业生就业创业“政策地图”作为政策宣传材料。

author: www.yunnan.cn,云南日报报业集团,云南网
title: 美国洛杉矶隧道坍塌 31人获救_国际_新闻频道_云南网
text:
原标题：美国洛杉矶隧道坍塌 31人获救
美国加利福尼亚州洛杉矶市消防局9日说，在该市当日发生的一起隧道坍塌事故中救出31名被困人员。
洛杉矶消防局说，这31人都是隧道工人，所有人暂无明显伤势。消防局仍在核实被困人数，目前尚无人员失踪报告。
根据消防局发布的信息，这条隧道直径约5.5米，用于市政污水处理，坍塌发生在距离唯一入口以南约8至9公里的一处地下挖掘点。被困工人爬过一堆数米高的松散泥土，与坍塌点另一侧的几名同事会合后被救出。
洛杉矶市消防局当天派出超过100名工作人员前往现场，其中包括专门从事密闭空间救援的人员。

author: @Kweku_Lawrence
title: GPL 2024/25: Heart of Lions beat Young Apostles to go three points clear
text:
Heart of Lions have moved three points clear at the top of the Ghana Premier League table with a slim win over Young Apostles.
The Kpando-based side claimed a 1-0 home win over Young Apostles on match day 15.
Kwesi Pong scored the only goal of the game in the second half to ensure Lions kept their position at the top of the league table.
Young Apostles came into the game on the back of three winless games and were hoping to turn their fortunes around.
However, they were denied a win with Lions condemning them to yet another defeat, their seventh of the season.
The two teams enjoyed a bright start to the game but it was the home side who threatened for the majority of the game.
The two teams went into the break with nothing to separate them.
The second half of the encounter was almost a similar story to that of the opening 45 minutes.
When the game seemed to be heading for a draw, Lions found the breakthrough.
Pong found an opening and ensured his strike beat the Young Apostles goalkeeper, handing Lions a late win.
The wins means Bashir Hayford’s men, with a game more than Bibiani GoldStars, take a three point lead.
